column2: CONNECTICUT DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Broken yellow lines:
column4: separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
column6: indicate you are in a no passing zone.
column8: separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the left
column6: You must bear either right or left

column2: 3. If your vehicle has a mechanical problem, you should:
column4: stop in your lane and put on your emergency flashers.
column6: signal and pull into the slow lane.
column8: turn on your hazard lights and pull off the road.

column2: 4. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 5. 16 and 17-year-old licensed drivers may not use a cell phone or mobile electronic device while driving. Violating this law will result in:
6. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 7. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 8. Fatigue increases the risk of:
9. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
10. Signs with orange backgrounds mean:
11. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
12. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 13. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
14. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 15. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.
column6: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions
column6: You must travel at the speed indicated

column2: 17. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 18. If you are about to be hit from behind, you should NOT:
column4: be ready to apply your brakes.
column6: put your head against the head restraint.
column8: let go of the steering wheel.

column2: 19. Passenger restrictions apply for _______ to license holders who have received their driver's license.
20. After you've held your driving license for 6 months, which one of the following passengers cannot be in the vehicle when you are driving?
21. When changing lanes, drivers should never:
column4: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 22. When driving at night, drivers should:
column4: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.

column2: 23. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
column8: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.

column2: 24. If a tire blows out, drivers should:
column4: hold the steering wheel tightly and use the brakes lightly.
column6: apply the brake firmly and hold it.

column2: 25. A driver distraction is anything that:
column6: takes the attention away from driving.
